required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Patients With Primary Open Angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension Switched to Lumigan® UD Monotherapy for Medical Reasons

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate patients diagnosed with primary open angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension who are switched to Lumigan® UD monotherapy for medical reasons in accordance with physician standard clinical practice. All treatment decisions lie with the physician.

primary_outcome.measure: Intraocular Pressure (IOP) in the Study Eye at Baseline
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the study eye.

primary_outcome.measure: IOP in the Study Eye at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the study eye.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of IOP-Lowering Effect in the Study Eye on a 3-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. Physicians evaluate IOP change from baseline in the study eye as better than expected, as expected, and worse than expected. The numbers of patients in each category are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Assessment of Tolerability on a 4-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Patient assessment of tolerability is assessed using a 4-point scale (very good, good, moderate, and poor). The numbers of patients in each category are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of Tolerability on a 4-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Physician assessment of tolerability is assessed using a 4-point scale (very good, good, moderate, and poor). The numbers of patients in each category are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Discontinue Treatment With Lumigan® UD Prior to 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Patient discontinuation of treatment with Lumigan® UD prior to 12 weeks of treatment is assessed as Yes or No.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Continue Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Patient continuation of treatment with Lumigan® UD after the end of study participation is assessed as Yes or No.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of Patient Compliance Compared to Previous Treatment on a 3-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Physician assessment of patient compliance compared to previous therapy is assessed on a 3-point scale (better, equal, and worse). The numbers of patients in each category are presented.

arm_group.description: Patients with primary open angle glaucoma (POAG) or ocular hypertension (OHT) treated with Lumigan® UD (bimatoprost ophthalmic solution) administered in accordance with physician standard practice for up to 12 weeks.

intervention.description: Patients with primary open angle glaucoma (POAG) or ocular hypertension (OHT) treated with Lumigan® UD (bimatoprost ophthalmic solution) administered in accordance with physician standard practice for up to 12 weeks.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension
- Previously prescribed intraocular pressure (IOP)-lowering medication with insufficient IOP control and is now being switched to Lumigan® UD for medical reasons
Exclusion Criteria:

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected for 12 weeks.

group.title: Patients With POAG or OHT
group.description: Patients with primary open angle glaucoma (POAG) or ocular hypertension (OHT) treated with Lumigan® UD (bimatoprost ophthalmic solution) administered in accordance with physician standard practice for up to 12 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
